trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> objects that can be individually accessed by index.
GradientStopCollection is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientBrush> classes to store <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStop> information.

Except as noted, members of this class behave exactly as described by the <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601>, <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601>, and <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%601> documentation.

**Freezable Features:** Because it inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> class, the GradientStopCollection class provides several special features: GradientStopCollection objects can be declared as , shared among multiple objects, made read-only to improve performance, cloned, and made thread-safe.
For more information about the different features provided by <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Implicit Collection Usage ``` ``` ## XAML Values *oneOrMoreGradientStopObjectElements* One or more objects, declared using object element syntax.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> class that contains the elements in the specified collection.
The collection to copy.
collection is .
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> class that is initially capable of storing the specified number of items.
The number of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> objects that the collection is initially capable of storing.
Adds a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> to the gradient stop collection.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.ICollection%601.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to add a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> to add to the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.
value is .
Removes all items from the gradient stop list.
This method does not change the capacity of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> is read-only.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true." name="true." href=""></xref>
To be added.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.

The cloned object's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> even if the source's <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen*> property was <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
To be added.
Determines whether the collection contains the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Copies the entire <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref> to a compatible one-dimensional <xref:System.Array>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the items copied from the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
array is .
index is less than zero.
array is multidimensional.
-or- The number of items in the source is greater than the available space from index to the end of the destination array.
Gets the number of items contained in a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.
This method implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.Count%2A> method from the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_netframewk](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-netframewk-md.md)].
The number of items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection"></xref>.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the collection.
Enumerators only allow reading the data in the collection.
Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first item in the collection.
also brings the enumerator back to this position.
At this position, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

Therefore, you must call <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> to advance the enumerator to the first item of the collection before reading the value of <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A>.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> returns the same object until either <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> is called.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> sets <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> to the next item.

After the end of the collection is passed, the enumerator is positioned after the last item in the collection, and calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> returns `false`.

If the last call to <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> returned `false`, calling <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> throws an exception.

To set <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> to the first item of the collection again, you can call <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> followed by <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A>.
An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged.

If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting items, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Reset%2A> throws an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.

If the collection is modified between <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.MoveNext%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator.Current%2A> will return the item that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.
An <xref:System.Windows.Media.GradientStopCollection.Enumerator> that can iterate through the collection.
Returns the zero-based index of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref>.
The item to search for.
The index if the object was found; otherwise, `-1`.
Inserts a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> at the specified position in the gradient stop list.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Insert%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The zero-based index at which to insert the object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> to insert.
value is .
index is not a valid index in the .
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> at the specified zero-based index.

Unlike typical implementations of <xref:System.Collections.Generic.IList%601.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, this implementation throws an <xref:System.ArgumentException> if you attempt to insert a **null** (**Nothing**) reference.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.GradientStop"></xref> at the specified index.

if value was removed from the ; otherwise, .
